author: Emel Akan
description: Companies unveil new investment and sales agreements in the areas of AI, energy, finance, and aerospace.
title: Trump Touts $270 Billion in Business Deals With Saudi Arabia at Investment Forum

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Indigenous Art Centre will no longer lend out its $14.4 million art collection after an audit found that more than 100 pieces of art have gone missing, Crown-Indigenous Relations Minister Rebecca Alty says. “The practice of lending out pieces to offices was discontinued,” Alty said while testifying before the House of Commons indigenous and […]
title: Indigenous Art Centre Won’t Loan Artwork After More Than 100 Pieces Went Missing

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Volcano Erupts in Indonesia, Patriot Systems Heading to Poland, and a White Rhinoceros Calf

author: Noé Chartier
description: U.S. Ambassador Pete Hoekstra said restarting trade talks with Canada will not be easy after they were cancelled by Washington following the airing of Ontario’s anti-tariff ad down south. Hoekstra said the move by Ontario Premier Doug Ford appeared to be without precedent and that anyone should “seriously consider” before adopting such a strategy to […]
title: US Ambassador Says Ontario’s Anti-US Tariff Ad Was Unprecedented, Restarting Trade Talks Won’t Be Easy

author: Bill Pan
description: Hong Kong increasingly resembles just another mainland Chinese city, the U.S.-China Economic and Security Review Commission says.
title: Congress Should Codify Trump Order Ending Hong Kong’s Special Trade Status, Advisory Panel Says

author: Chandra Philip
description: Only 2 percent of Canadian businesses report seeing a return on investment from artificial intelligence (AI) technologies, according to a recent survey. The survey, conducted by professional services firm KPMG, asked more than 750 business leaders about AI technology and investment in their organizations. It found 93 percent of organizations were using AI, up from […]
title: Canadian Firms Struggling to See Returns on AI Adoption: Survey

author: Travis Gillmore
description: The U.S. president vowed to work toward a peace deal in the third-largest African nation.
title: Trump Promises Saudi Crown Prince to Help Resolve Years-Long Conflict in Sudan

author: Matthew Horwood
description: B.C’s energy minister plans to introduce legislation next year to amend provincial policy mandating that all new light-duty vehicles sold be zero-emission by 2035. The move comes six years after B.C. became the first jurisdiction in the world to legislate such targets. Energy Minister Adrian Dix told reporters in Victoria that the electric vehicle (EV) […]
title: BC to End Policy Requiring All New Vehicles to Be Zero-Emission by 2035

author: Frank Fang
description: U.S. aerospace and defense company RTX is to build the National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile System (NASAMS) for Taiwan.
title: US Confirms Sale of Air Defense Missile System to Taiwan

author: Reuters
description: OTTAWA, Nov 19—The Bank of Canada on Wednesday called for a coordinated economy-wide approach to boost weak productivity, an issue it said was becoming more pressing in the face of challenges caused by U.S. trade policy. The speech by Deputy Governor Nicolas Vincent was the latest effort by the central bank to urge policy makers […]
title: Bank of Canada Urges Coordinated Approach to Boost Weak Productivity

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prince Edward Island RCMP has laid its first-ever terrorism charges in Atlantic Canada against a man accused of 3D-printing weapons for use in terrorist activities. The “landmark terrorism case” resulted from months of investigation that uncovered a suspect alleged to be part of an extremist threat, the RCMP said in a Nov. 19 press release. […]
title: Man Accused of 3D-Gun Printing Handed First Terrorism Charge in Atlantic Canada

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The average Canadian household discards $761 worth of food every year, with one third of that total—$246—stemming from confusion about how ‘best before’ dates work, a new study suggests. A recent national report published by food marketplace app Too Good To Go in collaboration with Dalhousie University’s Agri-Food Analytics Lab highlights Canadians’ lack of understanding […]
title: ‘Best Before’ Date Confusion Fuels Food Waste Across Canada: Study

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Industry Minister Mélanie Joly says Canada is boosting its funding for European Space Agency programs by $528.5 million as Ottawa seeks to build stronger ties with Europe. The new funding represents a tenfold increase compared to Canada’s previous contributions to the European Space Agency (ESA), and will be allocated over a three to five year […]
title: Canada Boosts European Space Agency Program Funding by $528M

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The study follows another that suggested that more than one in three adults (37 percent) have turned to AI chatbots for mental health support.
title: 1 in 5 Young AI Users Prefer ‘Talking’ to Tech Over Humans: Study

author: The Canadian Press
description: B.C. Liberal MPs said Wednesday the tanker ban on the northern B.C. coast can’t change without provincial and First Nations consent. The Globe and Mail is reporting that the federal government, which is in talks with Alberta on the prospect of building a new pipeline, is considering allowing some tanker traffic on the northern B.C. […]
title: BC Liberal MPs Say Tanker Ban Changes Would Need Provincial, First Nations Consent

author: Noé Chartier
description: Bloc Québécois Leader Yves-François Blanchet said the minority Liberals exploited a moment of weakness among opposition parties to pass their budget instead of working cooperatively to get them on board. Blanchet said this strategy worked this time around, but could come back to “bite” the Liberals in the future when they need the support of […]
title: Bloc’s Blanchet Says Liberals Leveraged Opposition’s ‘Weakness’ to Pass Budget, Warns of Consequences

author: Guy Birchall
description: The Russian spy ship Yantar, designed for intelligence gathering and mapping undersea cables, was spotted off the coast of Scotland.
title: UK Says ‘Military Options Ready’ After Russian Ship Uses Lasers Against Air Force

author: Catherine Yang, Stacy Robinson
description: The State Department is raising the reward for information leading to the capture of Wedding to $15 million.
title: US Brings New Charges, Raises Bounty on Accused Drug Trafficker Ryan Wedding

author: Terri Wu
description: China lends nearly $1 trillion to high-income countries, as much as its Belt and Road Initiative in the Global South.
title: US Largest Recipient of Chinese Loans, New Report Shows

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canada and Sweden announced they have established a “strategic partnership” that will entail enhanced military and Arctic cooperation. The agreement was signed as Sweden’s King Carl XVI Gustaf and Queen Silvia arrived in Ottawa on Nov. 18 and were welcomed at Rideau Hall. They met with Prime Minister Mark Carney, who said in a statement […]
title: Canada and Sweden Sign Strategic Partnership As Royal Family Visits Ottawa

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec Liberal Party Leader Pablo Rodriguez is calling for an independent, external investigation into what he says are serious allegations related to his leadership campaign. His comments are in reaction to a report by Quebecor about text messages suggesting that members who supported Rodriguez during the leadership race received cash rewards. In a short written […]
title: Quebec Liberal Leader Calls for External Investigation Into Report on Cash for Votes

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Industry Minister Mélanie Joly is asking two defence companies to compete for Canada’s fighter fleet order, saying the country’s current contract for American-made F-35 stealth fighter jets doesn’t deliver enough economic benefits. Joly told reporters this week that Ottawa is in talks with Swedish defence company Saab, which has dangled the possibility of 10,000 aerospace […]
title: Saab Offering 10,000 Jobs With Jet Purchase, as Ottawa Evaluates F-35 Deal, Joly Says

author: Guy Birchall
description: Both NATO nations have seen repeated violations of their airspace during Moscow's war against Kyiv.
title: Poland, Romania Scramble Jets After Russian Strikes on Ukraine

author: Dorothy Li
description: A Dutch government delegation is expected to travel to Beijing this week to seek a solution of the spat over Nexperia.
title: Netherlands Halts State Control of China-Owned Chipmaker Nexperia

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada’s national public alerting system is scheduled to be tested across the country today. A test message and tone from Alert Ready will be broadcast on television, radio and compatible wireless devices. Test messages will be issued in every province and territory at specific times between late morning and early afternoon. The system is typically […]
title: Alert Ready System to Undergo Public Test Across Canada

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Patriot systems are considered one of the most advanced air defense tools in the U.S. arsenal.
title: US Approves Potential $105 Million Sale of Patriot Air Defense System Sustainment to Ukraine

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The BoP will guide the formation of a Palestinian-international expert government and later hand Gaza to a reformed Palestinian Authority.
title: Trump Says Heads of Major Countries to Join Gaza Board of Peace

author: Monica O’Shea
description: 'I'm extremely concerned,' Minister Ryan Park said.
title: NSW Health Minister Warns Hospital Funding Falling Short of Federal Pledge

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Hugh Marks also told his reporters not to 'self-censor' or be held back by political blowback to certain stories.
title: ABC Head Rejects ‘Narrative of Decline’, Says Broadcaster More Relevant Than Ever

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: SA's education minister estimates the cost for the asbestos cleanup to be $11,000 per school.
title: SA Calls for National Inquiry Into the Importing of Asbestos Sand From China

author: Alfred Bui
description: 'Every single dollar a government spends comes from somebody else's pocket. It's the pocket of a family. It's the pocket of a small business,' said Jane Hume.
title: Corporations Benefit from Labor’s EV Policies While Taxpayers Suffer: Senator

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Twenty percent of immigrants to Canada leave the country within the first 25 years, and those holding doctorates are more than twice as likely to leave as those with high school or less, according to a new report from the Institute for Canadian Citizenship (ICC). Immigrants who leave Canada primarily do so within five years […]
title: 1 in 5 Immigrants Leave Canada Before 25 Years, Led by PhDs Holders: Report

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Unions demand emergency federal funding as cumulative cuts exceed 800 positions in 18 months.
title: CSIRO to Cut Up to 350 Jobs as Budget Pressures Bite

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) has updated its definition of “Canadian content” to expand its list of broadcasting production roles that qualify a television show or movie as Canadian, while saying that artificial intelligence in these roles doesn’t qualify. The federal broadcast regulator’s new definition, which determines whether a broadcasting production qualifies as […]
title: CRTC Releases Updated Definition of ‘Canadian Content’ for Broadcasting

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: New figures from the National Anti-Scam Centre show Scamwatch received 159,319 scam reports between January and September this year.
title: Australians Lose $260 Million to Scams as Black Friday Frenzy Fuels Criminal Activity

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta’s UCP government has tabled legislation invoking the notwithstanding clause to shield three laws passed last year, which deal with gender‑transition issues for minors, from legal challenges. Bill 9, tabled Nov. 18, uses the notwithstanding clause to uphold laws that bar those under 18 from gender transition surgery, restrict the teaching of gender identity topics […]
title: Alberta Invokes Notwithstanding Clause to Uphold Legislation Limiting Gender Transition for Minors

author: Emel Akan, Travis Gillmore
description: Russian oil prices are plunging as some international buyers held off on purchases after sanctions were imposed.
title: Oil Sanctions ‘Starving Putin’s War Machine’: Treasury Department

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The government of Alberta says it remains committed to ensuring that residents do not have to pay out-of-pocket for medical care, as a recent news report suggested the province is planning legislation that would allow doctors to provide services in both the public and private healthcare systems. “We remain committed to upholding Alberta’s Public Health […]
title: Alberta Vows Patients Will Never ‘Have to Pay’ for Healthcare as Report Says Province Planning Public-Private Parallel System

author: Jarvis Lim
description: They said algorithms designed to undermine public trust and fracture society are setting the stage for a forced cross-strait peace pact.
title: Chinese AI Models Spearhead Annexing of Taiwan: Experts

author: Chandra Philip
description: An iconic image of Banff National Park’s Moraine Lake will be the new backdrop on Alberta licence plates, with the words “Strong and Free” as the new motto. The province announced in mid-October that it would be allowing Albertans to pick the new design in an online tournament-style vote between Oct. 15 and Nov. 5. […]
title: Alberta Unveils New ‘Strong and Free’ Licence Plate Design

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Hughes names Price and Henderson as part of internal bloc allegedly undermining Ley.
title: ‘Inept and Lazy’: Hollie Hughes Leaves Liberals

author: Lily Zhou, Rachel Roberts
description: Speaker of the House of Commons Sir Lindsay Hoyle wrote to MPs on Tuesday to make them aware of the Espionage Alert issued by the intelligence agency.
title: MI5 Warns British Lawmakers of LinkedIn Threat From Chinese Spies

author: Audrey Simons
description: 'Protecting Christians in Nigeria is not about taking sides or dividing people—it is about uniting humanity,' the 42-year-old rapper said.
title: Nicki Minaj Says ‘Faith Is Under Attack’ in UN Speech About Persecution of Nigerian Christians
